root: ^I knew it was early when I opened my eyes.
^My phone was buzzing, but I did not recognize the number.

c-1: ^Later I heard the case was solved by another brilliant detective.
^Me? Couldn't feel better after a nice week's break.

c-0: ^Sherry: "Sherry here, sorry to disturb you on your holiday."
^(Right, I was on holiday. Why the hell did I pick this up?)
^Sherry: "A car crashed out of Hudson Bridge. Chief asked for you."

g-1: ^"Wait, chief crashed out of the bridge?!"
g-2: ^Sherry: "There was an accident on Hudson Bridge.
^"I see. Sorry about that. I am perfectly awake now."
g-3: ^I am afraid we need you ASAP, detective."
g-4: ^"You got it Sherry, I'll be there in 30 minutes."

c-5: ^We are at the East end of the bridge. I will brief you on site."

early: ^It was the break of dawn when I arrived.
^The sun was rising along the distant horizon,

g-0: ^I took a picture with me (press Tab to see)
^The team has been operating quietly in the darkness.
^(Better get this done before the streets get crowded)
g-1: ^I approached one of the officers, showing my badge
g-2: ^Officer: "Yes Detective Chen, Sherry's on the river bank. This way."
^The officer pulled up the cordon for me.

c-3: ^I looked over my shoulder, Lieutenant was leaning on his car.
^"Lieutenant... I'll catch up with you later, duty calls!"

c-0: ^I walked up to Lieutenant, he was putting a hotdog into his mouth.
^Lieutenant: "They brought you in for this? I thought you were on leave."
^"What can I say, you might be the only one respecting that."

g-0: ^He passed me a hotdog wrapped in paper.
^"Thanks. What brought you here? Since when you interested in homicide?"
g-1: ^Lieutenant: "Just checking in. I was on patrol."
^Lieutenant: "Does it look like a homicide to you?"
^"I hope they did not call me up on an accident."
g-2: ^Lieutenant: "I don't know. Looks like some poor man drove into the river."
^"We'll see. First I need to talk to an Investigator Sherry."

c-3: ^There's almost no water at this time of year, remember?"

Sherry_on_river_bank: ^It was the last day of January. The river did not freeze
^but it had shrank so much it exposed the riverbed.

g-0: ^Dark mud was soaked with damp moist.
^The Hudson River looked like a swamp,
^with a ominous smell barely suppressed by the cold air.
^I could see a giant pit in the middle of the swamp.
g-1: ^I took a picture with me (press Tab to see)
^(That must be where the car crashed in)

c-2: ^The pit looked like it was at least one hundred feet away from the breach on the bridge.
^(The car was at full speed when it crashed into the river)

c-0: ^I turned around, I believe I was met with Investigator Sherry.

g-0: ^She was wearing a red leather jacket and a pair of dark blue jeans.
^She held on to a torch with one hand and an iPad mini with another.
g-1: ^A car was found this morning 4:30 am in the middle of the river.
^It was reported by a street cleaner."
g-2: ^But I am not sure she could provide much help.
^She claimed she saw lights blinking in the middle of the river and called the police."
g-3: ^Sherry: "The driver was found dead in his car.
^The victim was the only passenger and has been identified as

information: ^"You said the victim was the only person in car?"
^"Did you find anything on the victim?"

c-0: ^there was a wind storm last night and everyone stayed home."
^"They should have at least heard something, if a car crashed out of the bridge?"
^"Then how did we come to the conclusion of a car crash?"

g-0: ^The happening of the event was caught by one of our civilian cameras."
g-1: ^Sherry: "For sure. A copy has been sent to your office as well."
^She pulled out the iPad and played the footage for me.
g-2: ^The view was nice and clear. It was slightly past 1am.
^Mr Jenkins' car was the only vehicle in sight.
^On entering the bridge on the East side, the car sped up.
^About a hundred feet onto the bridge,
^the car made a sudden turn and crashed into the fences.
g-3: ^I took a picture at the moment the car crashed.
^“Doesn't look like the car skidded or something."
g-4: ^Sherry: "It doesn't. For one thing, the road wasn't frozen."
g-5: ^Sherry: "It doesn't look like a traffic accident.
^I guess that's why Chief appointed you, detective."

c-1: ^Sherry (Investigator): "Yes. The time of death is estimated to be between 12am to 2am.
^The cause of death was chest demage due to collision.
^The tests have proved the victim was not drunk,
^but we are still waiting for drug tests."

g-0: ^I took a picture of the report.
g-1: ^Unfortunately it did not save Mr Jenkins' life."

c-2: ^We would like you to examine it, before we sent to our technicians."

s: ^"Before that I would like to know..."

c-3: ^Sherry: "Yes, sir. There were no other casualties.
^In fact, the car was almost... empty."
^"What do you mean the car was empty?"

g-0: ^Sherry: "You know, there were no personal belongings in the car."
g-1: ^We have sent our request to Traffic Department.
^I will update you once we found out the owner of that car."
^"Okay. And if anyone had come close to that car..."
g-2: ^Besides, he would leave traces on this swamp."

c-4: ^Sherry (Investigator): "Yes, we have informed his wife this morning.
^She should be at the hospital identifying the body, at this moment."
^"She did not notice her husband went missing?"

g-0: ^Sherry: "I am afraid you will have to ask her.
^I will let you talk to her when she's ready."

s: ^"Okay, next I would like to know..."

c-5: ^His wallet, his phone and a ring of keys,
^a few cigarettes and a lighter. They are kept in bags, Here."

g-0: ^Small notes, 2 bank cards, 1 traffic card, ID, 2 tickets,
^a piece of band aid and a piece of condom.

c-1: ^2 tickets are from Vienetta Theatre, 10pm to 12pm yesterday.

c-0: ^I took a picture of the tickets.

g-3: ^(Cheapest lighter you can find on the streets.)
g-4: ^One cigarette seemed to have fallen out of the packet.

c-8: ^(Wait, it's not the same as the rest of the cigarettes in the packet?)

c-0: ^I took a picture of the cigarettes.

g-6: ^"The first thing is to recover his phone."
^"The first thing is to have a look at his bank transaction records."
^"The first thing is to let me talk to Viennata Theatre."

c-10: ^Sherry (Investigator): "I see. I am afraid it will take some time.
^Repairing is one thing, unlocking it is another.
^Meanwhile I can do one more thing for you."
^"I need to have a look at his bank transaction records."
^"I need to talk to Viennata Theatre."

c-0: ^Sherry (Investigator): "I see. The bank may request a warrant,
^but I will see what I can do."

c-11: ^Sherry (Investigator): "I see. The bank may request a warrant,
^but I will see what I can do. Meanwhile I can do one more thing for you."
^"I need to talk to Viennata Theatre."

c-0: ^Sherry (Investigator): "I see. I am afraid it will take some time.
^Repairing is one thing, unlocking it is another. I will try."

c-12: ^Meanwhile I can do one more thing for you."
^"I need to have a look at his bank transaction records."

c-0: ^Sherry (Investigator): "I see. I am afraid it will take some time.
^Recovering is one thing, unlocking it is another. I will try."
c-1: ^Sherry (Investigator): "I see. The bank may request a warrant.
^I will see what I can do."

b: ^Me: "Thank you Sherry, you have been helpful.
^If you would, please, I would like to examine the car now."
^Sherry (Investigator): "Glad to be of help. I will leave you alone."
^"I will let you know when I am done."

c-0: ^A red sedan sat on the river bank alone,
^seemed to be forgotten by the other officers.
^It looked normal from behind but at a closer look,

b: ^Sherry (Investigator): "Good to know. I will send the information you need
^to your office. Meanwhile let me know if you have other questions."
^"Right. Thank you, Sherry. See you back in the office."

s: ^** Examine the front of the car **

c-0: ^Red Chevrolet Impala. Right hand side of the car was bumped, the headlight broken.
^The hood was bent and open, the engine cold.
^The windshield shattered but remained one piece.
^(Average car. Not beyond repair, but it's no pleasure to look at.)
^I took a picture of the front of the car.

c-1: ^The interior looked clean and in good condition, there were no accessories.
^(So it is Mr Jenkins' new car)
c-2: ^Empty except for a thin blanket at the bottom.

back_to_office: ^Sitting behind this desk always gives me calmness and strength to think,
^as the world outside can often be cold and intimidating.
^(To some extent that's why people like me are needed, I guess)

c-1: ^Sherry (Investigator): "Detective, I have updated the information on the system. In short,
^-- the victim wasn't drunk nor on drug.

b: ^-- The phone needed more time to recover.

^-- According to his bank statements,

^Mr Jenkins rented a car from Mark's Car Rental yesterday afternoon.

^He also bought 2 tickets from Vienetta Theatre last night, the show started 8:45pm.
^--The car was confirmed by Traffic Department to belong to a Mark's Car Rental.

c-1: ^-- I have contacted Vienetta Theatre for you. They agreed to talk."

g-1: ^"Thank you, Sherry. I will take it from here."

b: ^"This is Chen. I am a detective from NCPD."

c-0: ^"This is Chen, calling from NCPD. My deepest condolences."
c-1: ^"I am afraid yes. My deepest condolences, Mrs Jenkins."

later_calls: ^"We have a few service groups, for trauma support."
^"Yes. I hope you are alright, Mrs Jenkins."

g-0: ^"I hate to bring it up but I have a few more questions regarding this case."
g-1: ^"Yes. That is, if you don't mind, Mrs Jenkins."

questions: ^"Does the name Catherine Fox ring any bell?"
^"Was it your car that Mr Jenkins was driving?"
^"(SKIP)That's um, all I need to know for now. Have some rest."

c-0: ^Mrs Jenkins: "..I knew it! I always warned him against smoking while driving..."
^"Hmm, that may or may not be the case. Actually, what brand does he smoke?"

g-0: ^Mrs Jenkins: "Blue Mountains, why? He always grabs from our own grocery store."
g-1: ^Mrs Jenkins: "Isn't that a luxury brand? I don't think we even had that in store."

g-0: ^"I am afraid Mr Jenkins'd been having an affair with this lady."

c-1: ^(Emm, I really need her to be emotionally stable at this point.)

c-0: ^"Unfortunately that's the truth. Now if you could..."

g-1: ^Mrs Jenkins: "What is it you want me to do?"
g-2: ^"Doesn't privacy mean anything to you" was the last word I heard.
^She had hang up, or she might have broke her phone, who knows.

c-2: ^Mrs Jenkins: "..I am sure this is just a routine question?"
^"Exactly, I take it you were not with Mr Jenkins when he was driving?"

g-0: ^Mrs Jenkins: "No, I wasn't... Bill and I had dinner together,
^"Wait, you weren't with him at the threatre?"

c-1: ^Mrs Jenkins: "He did not mention. But I think it was business."

g-1: ^Mrs Jenkins: "Yeah. Bill, um, had been hard-working."
g-2: ^Mrs Jenkins: "He, um, had other businesses I think."
g-3: ^Mrs Jenkins: "..No much. He told me a few months back
^that he ran into a business partner and that's all."
g-4: ^"With all due respect Mrs Jenkins, were you not concerned?"
g-5: ^Mrs Jenkins: "About what? My husband's business? He'd been working late to bring
^food to our table.. I.. It's been really bad these days, our grocery business."
^"And you stayed home until morning? Did you try to contact him at any point?"
g-6: ^Mrs Jenkins: "I called Bill when the wind storm came.
^He did not answer but he texted me. That was uh, let me check, around 10pm."
g-7: ^Mrs Jenkins: "He said he would be late and that I should rest first."
g-8: ^Mrs Jenkins: "That's correct. I watched television until late
^but I had Migraine, so I went to bed early."
^"Can you recall the shows you have watched last night?"
g-10: ^"No problem. Thanks Mrs Jenkins. You have been helpful."

c-3: ^Mrs Jenkins: "No, we do not have cars."
^"We believe Mr Jenkins had rented it."

g-0: ^Mrs Jenkins: "Em, is it supposed to mean anything?"
^"The car belongs to Mark's Car Rental. Does it sound familiar to you?"
g-2: ^Mrs Jenkins: "Bill, uh, only got his license months ago."
^"I see. By the way, can you drive?"
g-3: ^Mrs Jenkins: "No, I cannot. Uh, detective, could he have run into an accident?"

first_call: ^Man: "Mark's Car Rental. How can I help you?"
^"Hi, am I speaking to the owner?"

g-0: ^I heard someone shouted in the background.
g-1: ^The man probably attended to the person who shouted at him cos he started shouting too.

c-2: ^The voice in the background: "Where ... my wax ... last wednesday ..."
^Man: "What would I know about it? Just get a new box! I got business here."
^"I was hoping to speak to the owner."

c-0: ^Man: "Nah, that was my colleague, sorry about that."
^"Right, I was hoping to speak to the owner."

c-1: ^Man: "Huh, he's probably the most forgetful technician ever born.
^"Okay, I was hoping to speak to the owner."

g-1: ^Man: "Damn, I mean sorry, officer. I will pass it to Mark."

second_call: ^Man: "Mark's Car Rental. May I help you?"
^"Yes please, can I speak to the owner?"

g-0: ^"Detective Chen, from NCPD. I called once before."
g-1: ^Man: "Oh, detective. I will pass to Mark."

c-2: ^"Can I speak to you for a moment?"

g-1: ^"Right, Carlos. Remember last time we talked about the missing wax?"
^"Right, Carlos. Do you know Mark well?"

g-0: ^Carlos (Technician): "No, we did not bother. We are not short of Fel Wax anyway."
^"What exactly does the Gel Wax do anyway?"
g-1: ^Carlos: "The Fel Wax. We use it for molding.
^After heated it is like plasticine, can bend it into any shape."
g-2: ^"Cool, thanks. Can I speak to Mark now?"

c-3: ^Carlos (Technician): "Yes, I have been working with him for the past 13 years.
^"Does the name Bill Jenkins sound familiar to you?"

g-0: ^Carlos (Technician): "Ah yeah, Mr Jenkins. Also a good friend of ours. What about him?"
g-1: ^Carlos (Technician): "Yeah, he always comes to us for car renting."
^"I see, now may I speak to Mark? Thanks."

owner_first_time: ^I heard some whispers, indistinguishable. The man's probably introducing me.
^"Hi, call me Chen. You must be Mark?"

g-0: ^Mark: "That's right. Mark Picasso, at your service."
^"Do you know a Mr Bill Jenkins?"
g-1: ^Mark: "Yeah, he is one of our customers."
g-2: ^Mark: "Not really, but I did handle every car rental case myself, so...
^Mr Jenkins always favors our serive than our competitors and I appreciate it."
^"Mr Jenkins died of a car crash this morning."
g-3: ^"Unfortunately yes. Did you notice anything about him yesterday?"
g-5: ^Mark: "Bill Jenkins... Well, not much I am afraid.
^He practically copied his application form from last time.
^The case was handled in under 10 minutes."
^"Anything that he said or did, possibly?"
g-6: ^Mark: "Well, not really. He did not say much.
^Come to think about it, he was a bit too quiet yesterday."
^"I see. Thanks Mark. Let me know if you recalled anything from yesterday."

owner_second_time: ^I could hear footsteps of going upstairs.
questions: ^"I heard that you are good friends with Mr Bill Jenkins?"

c-0: ^"I feel the same way. Lucky Strike is my favourite."

g-0: ^I have been smoking it since I inherited the business from my old man."
g-1: ^"A Lucky Strike cigarette was found on Mr Jenkins' body."
g-3: ^Mark: "I guess not so lucky after all.. Haha.. sorry that was a bad joke."
g-4: ^Mark: "Actually... I might have given it to him."
g-5: ^Mark: "Well, he was quiet that day and I thought I should cheer him up.
^I made a joke and it did not work. I think I offered him that cigarette after that."
g-6: ^Mark: "It is really good stuff, you know. It would have cheered him up."

c-1: ^Mark: "I try to make good friends with every customer."

g-0: ^Mark: "I hate to break it but, you know, sometimes you make the most money
g-1: ^"Your friendship with Mr Jenkins, has it ever gone beyond business?"
g-2: ^"Like, do you only meet for car renting?"
g-3: ^Mark: "Mostly, yeah. AlthoughI did invite some of our customers to events
^"When was the first time you met each other?"

g-2: ^Mark: "Well, you would have to ask the technicians."

c-3: ^Mark: "Uhh, I have asked around but nothing came up."

first_call: ^"Hi, Detective Chen here. And I am speaking to?"

g-0: ^Jack (Manager at Vienetta Theatre): "Jack, General Manager here at Vienetta Theatre."
^"Hi, Jack. I believe Sherry had contacted you?"
g-2: ^I have prepared the evidence for you."
g-3: ^Jack: "Yes, Mr Jenkins bought 2 tickets from us for last night's show.
^One under his own name, the other under the name of a Catherine Fox.
^He and his companion were both caught by our CCTV."
g-4: ^Jack: "The evidence should have been conveyed to you via Miss Redfield."
^"That's, um, great. I'll have a look."
g-5: ^Jack: "Hmm, now if there's no futher queries,
^my request is that we quickly get this over with."
g-6: ^we don't want to be associated to Mr Jenkins' death.
^"With all due respect, SIR, aren't you ruthless?"
g-7: ^Jack (Manager): "Believe me, sir. You learn to fear people's words in this business."
g-8: ^Jack (Manager): "Now if you don't mind, I must attend to other matters."
g-9: ^Sherry has updated Catherine Fox's number for me.

later_calls: ^Jack (Manager at Vienetta Theatre): "Officer, I mean, detective. With all due respect,
^we do not have more information to offer."

g-0: ^People have started to talk about there was a murder in our theatre here!"
g-1: ^Jack: "No, it's not. And you know what it is?
^It's called rumor! Please do not call again, we have a business to run!"

first_call: ^"Hi, am I speaking to Miss Catherine Fox?"

g-0: ^"My name is Chen. I am calling from NCPD."
g-1: ^Catherine: "Oh. Let me guess, did you just freeze my bank account?"
g-2: ^"You went to Vienetta Theatre with Mr Bill Jenkins last night."
g-3: ^(Well, I should think of a better way to introduce myself.)
^Catherine: "Sorry officer. I thought you were one of those scammers."
g-4: ^"Miss Fox, I would appreciate it if you could spare a few minutes?"
g-5: ^"You know Mr Bill Jenkins, don't you?"
g-7: ^Catherine: "Yes, he is a friend. Did he give you my number?"
^"No he didn't. How long have you known him?"
g-8: ^"Two months and you went to the theatre together."
g-12: ^"Mr Jenkins was found dead this morning."
g-13: ^"And he was with you last night."
g-14: ^Catherine: "What? No, no no no. You've got it all wrong!
^We were.. In a relationship. I wouldn't have killed him!"

g-0: ^Catherine: "I have told you what I had to tell you."

questions: ^"How did you come to know each other?"
^"That's all for now. Please remain contactable in the next few days."

g-0: ^Catherine: "We met at the theatre. We watched the musical together."
g-1: ^Catherine: "He walked me home. We kissed goodbye.
^He went on the bus and I have not seen him since."
g-2: ^Catherine: "Sure. The theatre was full of people."
^"Did anyone see you at your place?"
g-4: ^Catherine: "Around 11:30PM. I remember because he almost missed the last bus home."
^"Mr Jenkins got on the last bus back home?"
g-5: ^Catherine: "Yes, and I have not seen him since."
g-6: ^"I am going to ask you again, what had happened last night?"
g-7: ^Catherine: "I have told you what I remembered."
g-8: ^"You did not know it, because you did not see him getting in his car."

^"I will have to have you in for interrogation."
g-12: ^You can have me in but it is going to be the same story!"
g-13: ^Catherine: "We parted ways in front of the theatre.
^We had a quarrel. But it is not like what you think!
^He said he would break up with me, I wanted him to stay."
g-14: ^Catherine: "Him? He said it was a mistake and he wanted to go back to his life!"
g-15: ^Catherine: "Fuck him. Fuck him! He deserve to be dead but I did not kill him!"
g-17: ^Catherine: "There's people watching and he wouldn't say anything.
^He just pulled out a cigarette like nothing had happened."

^"Did anyone see you back at home?"
g-22: ^Catherine: "I did not kill him, officer. I did not."

c-0: ^The case was later directed to Traffic Department.
^I have not heard of it since. God bless him.
c-1: ^It looked more like a suicide act according to the footage.
^Later the case was concluded as a suicide,
^although rumor had it there was no decisive proof presented.
^I should be careful not to stress myself out at work...
c-2: ^Mrs Jenkins behaved really suspicious and I arrested her for interrogation.
^I will be there when she spit out the truth about Mr Jenkins' death.
c-3: ^I will be there when he spit out the truth about Mr Jenkins' death.

b:
^As it turned out, Mark was not only a close friend to Mr Jenkins,

^but also his secret business partner. That business was of course, illegal.

^On the day Mr Jenkins died, he wanted to part ways with Mark,

^"because he had enough and only wanted to live his life."

^Mark took down a piece of hardware on the car rented to Mr Jenkins,

^and replaced it with a piece of Fel Wax. That piece of Fel Wax did not hold

^under the heat of a driving vehicle and melted away. That was when Mr Jenkins'

^car lost control and drove into the river.

c-4: ^After all, she was the last person Mr Jenkins had met.
^I will be there when she spit out the truth about Mr Jenkins' death.
